title: Polish and modernize the login UI across roles

requirements.text: Upgrade the visual design of all login-related screens to look more premium and “cool” while keeping the existing school-friendly blue/white base theme: Role selection, Visitor login, Admin login, Student login, and Student apply pages. Improvements should include a more polished background (e.g., subtle gradient + soft decorative shapes), improved card styling (depth, borders, glow), and smoother micro-animations for initial load and hover/focus states.

quotes: can you j\est make login ui more cool

acceptanceCriteria: The following pages have noticeably improved styling and motion without changing their core functionality: frontend/src/pages/RoleSelectPage.tsx, VisitorLoginPage.tsx, AdminLoginPage.tsx, StudentLoginPage.tsx, StudentApplyPage.tsx.
All pages remain mobile-responsive and look good at common breakpoints (mobile, tablet, desktop).
No user-facing text is changed to non-English; existing copy remains simple English.
Animations respect reduced-motion preferences (no distracting looping motion when prefers-reduced-motion is enabled).

requirements.text: Make form inputs and buttons on login/apply pages feel more modern and interactive: consistent spacing, stronger focus rings, clearer error states, optional leading icons where appropriate, and improved button hover/pressed/loading states (including disabled appearance).
acceptanceCriteria: Inputs show a clear focus state (ring/border) consistent with the existing Tailwind theme variables.
Error states are visually distinct (border + helper text), and remain accessible (sufficient contrast).
Buttons have consistent hover/active/disabled styling across Visitor/Admin/Student login and Student apply pages.
Existing loading behavior remains correct (e.g., Student login shows spinner when pending; submit buttons disable during pending mutations).

requirements.text: Improve the Role Selection page presentation to feel more premium: refine card layout/typography, enhance the role icon tiles, and add subtle motion/hover effects that feel cohesive with the login pages (without adding new navigation steps or changing the current routes).
acceptanceCriteria: Role cards have enhanced visual hierarchy (title/description balance, spacing) and a cohesive premium style matching the updated login screens.
Hover/focus states for role cards are smooth and clear, and do not cause layout shift.
Clicking each role still navigates to the same existing paths (/student-apply, /visitor-login, /admin-login) with SPA behavior.

constraints: Do not modify any immutable frontend paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (e.g., frontend/src/main.tsx and frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts).
Do not change backend logic, authentication rules, passwords, or routing behavior; this request is UI/UX polish only.
nonGoals: Adding new authentication methods or changing how login works (Internet Identity, tokens, sessions, passwords).
Changing admin/visitor/student password values or introducing password reset flows.
Backend changes, schema changes, or new canister methods.
